titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. W. R. Babb et al., Indictment
CWG6378

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
W R Babb A L Banks Wm Wallace E C Lusk & Jas Newberry & Jasper Babb

The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name and by the Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse W R Babb A L Banks, Wm Wallace E C Lusk Jas. Newberry & Jasper Babb of the Crime of horse stealing Committed as follows, viz, The said W R Babb A L Banks Wm Wallace, E C Lusk Jas Newberry and Jasper Babb did on the 14th. day of April 1865 in the county aforesaid feloniously take & carry away -- one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of Jacob Roark

The grand jury Aforesaid charge that at the time and place aforesaid the said John Newberry & E. C Lusk feloniously took and Carried away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of Jacob Roark and the aforesaid W R Babb A L Banks Wm Wallace & Jasper Babb were accessories before the fact by conselling aiding advising & encouraging the said theft

The grand jury aforesaid charge that at the time and place aforesaid the said Wm Wallace & Jasper Babb feloniously took & carried away one horse of the value of one hundred dollars the personal property of Jacob Roark and the aforesaid W R Babb, A L Banks E C Lusk & Jas Newberry were accessories before the fact by Counselling, aiding abetting advising & encouraging the said theft -- all against the peace & dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Jacob Roark -- Wm Holt.
Starlon Sheron -- Franklin Harris
Ed Moore of Graves County
Zeke Maynor Tom Allbratten.
A copy -- attest B Snall C M C C
"Bail is fixed on this indictment at Five hundred dollars for each defendant
W R Babb has been discharged by order of court

Commonwealth
vs } Horse Stealing
W R Babb & others

A true bill
J G Cole
foreman.
